content.question: A sample of an ideal gas is in a sealed container with a moveable piston. During a thermodynamic process, the pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> and volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi></math> of the gas can be described by the equation <math alttext="P equals the fraction a over V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mi>V</mi></mfrac></math>, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> is a positive constant with appropriate units. The graph shows <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> as a function of <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi></math> during the process. Which of the following claims best describes how the temperature of the gas changes, if at all, during the process?

choices.label: The temperature could decrease, increase, or stay the same depending on how many atoms are in the gas.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
